text:
Hello together!
We have the following Problem and I would be grateful for some feedback from anybody:
We are using Borlabs Cookie Banner on a Wordpress Page. I added the HubSpot tracking code in Borlabs, so far so good, but now I want to also Track the LinkedIn Pixel using the HubSpot Integration, but I need a separate Borlabs consent for that. Is there a way using the Tracking Code API to allow a single Tracking Pixel (So not “Marketing” in general, but rather “LinkedIn” only, so I can create a Borlabs Consent for that.
Any help would be appreciated! Thanks!
Hello, can someone help me? It is possible to customize the attachment , introducing a drag and drop, and how. Thanks in advance.
Hey! Does anyone know if there is possible to get the sales analytics report for historical snapshots in another currency than the company currency?
That's really for any emails that came in with attachments, or notes and other things like that
not just a place to put files on a record
Where do you see this file?
For a HubSpot account?
Yes, i am developing in HubSpot chat
I need to build a card like this where the files can be moved and organized by drag and drop
Thanks for the answer
but you want the country code calling code number, country, and region details for a specific HubSpot account?
Yeah currently that isn't possible, even with custom crd cards (because you can't embed an iframe), I would suggest adding notes to the record and then they will show up right there
attach a file to the note of course
The problem is that I can't find where to access the code in the system. I watched all the tutorials, but they are different from the ones I have in my developer account
What do you mean by code?
I need to develop an option to be able to organize the files, but I don't really understand what I could do. Do you have an idea, maybe. Thank you very much for the answer

You unfortunately can't organize those files, one thing you could do is to create a folder in the file manager for file just for that one record and upload files into there, this wouldn't show up on the record page through, and you wouldn't be able to drop files on that crm card

Hi,
Using form embed I’ve added a form to an external website landing page. Usually I can override styles as needed by targeting elements/classes/ids as needed and using !important. However I’m finding on one particular site this is not working. I also can’t modify this form from the HubSpot end, it has to be done on the website end.

Are there any other options left for overriding styles of this this form?
in the form editor there is a option to get the form without styling
Where? I’m not finding that or info about it
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/how-can-i-share-a-HubSpot-form-if-im-using-an-external-site>
see bottom of this page
"Set as raw html form"
then you also probably don´t need to use !important
The form is already in use in hundreds of pages and dozens of sites
WOn’t this affect it everwhere?
probably. i would clone it and see how it looks, then style it

I think this may be my answer. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Custom-Form-Style/td-p/5707>

Specifically
```       css: '',
       cssRequired: '',```
I don't see it. I want it.
You're trying to see the log ins for your portal? what exactly are you hoping to find?
Curious if there's been less HubSpot employee dev support in this slack now that HubSpot is emphasizing paid plans to receive support?
HubSpot support isn't really provided in here at all
You can CC HubSpotters and get answers
but really just meant as a community channel
They definitely used to be around more
There were a couple of people that would jump in and give good insight occasionally, it was really nice
Smaller population these days: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PJ878V/p1675182173830629>

Hey <@UDLS0CYPP>! I lead Developer Community here at HubSpot and just wanted to clarify something. This Slack is not meant to be an official HubSpot support channel and is not staffed as such. Rather, it's  a place for HubSpot developers to gather and offer peer to peer support and the opportunity to network. As Carter mentions, some HubSpotters like to hang out here to be close to our developer community, but providing support via this Slack is strictly voluntary on their part. The <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Developers/ct-p/developers?_ga=2.6948539.864928936.1675107870-1858677839.1666187419|Community> has more dedicated folks that can help you get answers if you're not on a paid plan.

Sure is what it sounds like, then. That's a real shame - it was really special to have the chance to form some small connections with people who were actually part of building the things we care about in HubSpot. I mean, the finances of the change make sense, of course, it's just disappointing.
All the cool people are still here
You gotta stop single-handedly carrying the show, Carter, haha

I hear that loud and clear. As a note, we're aware that our dev support experience isn't that great today - we're making that, and the opportunity for our community to have more Carters (lol), a priority this year
but really most every PM is still here, and all really responsive. You just need to know who to CC to get replies
they don't watch the channels as much, but still check the slack for notifications
Carter is a sleuth but we know that's not an ideal way to feel heard lol
100% not saying it's ideal, but they haven't abandoned per say

> All the cool people are still here
Hopefully that includes us advocates (minus that <@UD53A9UUR> character :wink:)
I think <@UD53A9UUR> just added the :sprocket: icon to his profile
<https://media.tenor.com/U10i0dIwlcwAAAAM/buddy-the-elf-hes-an-impostor.gif> Yes, I just spend 3 minutes finding this
I swear <@U01QVR44MEY> doesn't even work. Just wonders around this slack full time
We all have hobbies
<https://media.giphy.com/media/GVJ4NhokeHLWGcmBfM/giphy.gif>
That is false Dennis, you hear that HubSpot shirt better then anyone
oh i hear it, alright.  someday i may wear it
if you edit your message, carter, my message wont make any sense
I'm not going to edit it
<@UDLS0CYPP>, i am not jealous of your profile photo at all
<@UD53A9UUR> I think you have one of the better profile pictures
I'm still 12 in mine (:joy:) might be time for a change...
Haha, you know, just a casual walk in the hills with my soulmate xD But I sit at a desk sometimes, too, I swear.
log ins? no
I want access.log file for the website.

Sorry, I didn't understand at first. Currently you can't do that with hubspt, you could access it from your DNS provider though, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Reporting-Analytics/Access-for-log-file-of-website/m-p/639793/highlight/true#M3352>
DNS provider?!
Yes DNS provider might be your only option!!!!
are you saying this because you've done it before or because you've found someone else mention it online?
I've done it before, and I can also see that other people think it's a good idea
I use Cloudflare which makes it really easy, don't know which DNS you use. Definitely will be different
Let me know if you have any other questions
I'm not sure how a DNS provider can help me with capturing a url that the user requested.
the DNS sees the user every time they try to access a website with a domain hosted on said DNS
For example here's how to do the setup using my DNS (cloudflare) <https://developers.cloudflare.com/analytics/web-analytics/getting-started/#sites-proxied-through-cloudflare>
Then you'll see all the analytics in the website's dashboard (screenshot from my dashboard for today):
Does this make sense? What DNS are you using?
"the DNS sees the user every time they try to access a website with a domain hosted on said DNS". That's not true.

Hi guys,
I am using a cookiebot and a HubSpot site, but on contact, I can not tell if the customer accepted the cookies or declined them.
I tried reading through this documentation but still, I don't get it if it is possible or not. <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/privacy-and-consent/what-cookies-does-HubSpot-set-in-a-visitor-s-browser#:~:text=When%20a%20visitor%20accepts%20cookies,to%20your%20third%2Dparty%20system>

I know it is possible if you're using a HubSpot cookie banner but I am not sure because I am using a Cookiebot cookie banner.
